instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
When I started working on this board it chimed but had a black screen. After looking at the board i found that <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR> was ripped off so I replaced it. Then I saw corrosion in the lvds area around <TRANSISTOR>Q4262</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q4262</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R4262</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R4263</RESISTOR> (those are for firewire) and then I replaced LVDS connector.

Now I have backlight, white screen, but no image. Tried different screens with same resault.
Where do I start

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: White screen would suggest there is no 3V getting to the LCD. Check voltage on <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>, L9004 is suspect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>. 
Now it works. Thanks again for your help.
